newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY RADIO NOON HEADLINES - OCT 22.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY RADIO NOON HEADLINES - OCT 22.

text.p: These are the main headlines on Hungary's Kossuth Radio midday news. Reuters cannot vouch for their accuracy:
- The Parliament began the discussion of the draft 1997 budget on Tuesday.
- Finance Minister Peter Medgyessy said in its opening speech to the discussion of the draft budget that real wages and consumption would not continue to decline next year.
- The opposition party Fidesz proposed that the highest personal income tax key should be 40 percent in 1997.
- Government employees demanded 10 percent wage rise from January.
- Fifteen participant of the 1956 uprising received Pro Urbe awards in the presence of President Arpad Goncz, who said 1956 was the revolution of human dignity.
- The government is determined to complete the reform of jurisdiction before the 1998 elections, Minister of jusice Pal Vastagh said.
